meanings.sent1: The glass prism showed its refractile nature by splitting the light into a rainbow.
meanings.sent2: The diamond's refractile quality made it sparkle in the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The refractile crystal danced with colors as the light passed through it.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes had a refractile gleam, reflecting her excitement.

meanings.definition: Having the property of refracting light.
meanings.sent1: The lens in the telescope was refractile, focusing the light to see distant stars.
meanings.sent2: The prism's refractile surface bent the light at different angles.
meanings.sent3: The refractile mirror made the room look distorted and funny.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a refractile beam of sunshine, brightening up the room.
meanings.sent5: The refractile glass sculpture created beautiful patterns of light on the walls.

meanings.definition: Able to bend or change direction when passing through a medium.
meanings.sent1: The refractile nature of the water caused the straw to appear bent.
meanings.sent2: The refractile properties of the diamond made it appear larger than it was.
meanings.sent3: The refractile light in the aquarium made the fish look like they were swimming in different directions.
meanings.sent4: His refractile thoughts seemed to shift and change with each passing moment.
meanings.sent5: The refractile waves in the pond created a mesmerizing ripple effect.
